授業目的:
1.
To develop students’ English proficiency through the study of academic topics
in the field of sociology.

2.
To build students’ confidence in using English as a communicative tool.

3.
To help students improve their listening and note-taking skills through
extensive lecture-listening activities. 

4.
To introduce students to significant vocabulary words relevant to a wide range
of academic topics. 

5. To
prepare students to actively take part in discussions, teaching them the
fundamental skills for agreeing and disagreeing with others’ opinions.
到達目標:
1.
Students will develop their academic skills. 

2.
Students will become more confident and effective communicators.

3.
Students will strengthen their listening comprehension, note-taking and
discussion skills.

4.
Students will acquire new vocabulary that will enhance their academic
achievement.
授業方法:
1. This course will be conducted in
English only and English will be the means of communication between the
students and the instructor.  (Students
will also be expected to communicate with one another in English.)

2.  Students
are encouraged to actively participate in class discussions, both independently
and collaboratively, in order to enhance their competence and confidence in
English and also to create a better learning environment for all.

成績評価備考:
備考　Note
1. Active participation is extremely important and counts as a significant part of students’ evaluation marks. 
2. Attendance is crucial to students’ success in this course. The instructor will carefully mark students’ attendance as present and on time, late, or absent. Specific rules regarding attendance are as follows:
2a) Only students who are present at the time the class begins will receive full attendance marks.
2b) Any student walking into the classroom after the class has begun will be marked late. The instructor will take this into account when giving students a participation grade.
2c) Being 15 to 29 minutes late will equal half an absence (0.5).
2d) Each time students are late 30 minutes or more, they will be marked absent. However, they are still encouraged to attend. 
2e) No more than three absences will be permitted in this course. Any student who is absent more than three times will automatically fail this course.
